summary: The Youth Mental Health Research Act (H.R. 2587) aims to establish a Youth Mental Health Research Initiative within the National Institutes of Health (NIH). The initiative, led by the National Institute of Mental Health and in collaboration with other institutes, will coordinate and encourage research on youth mental health. This research will focus on building resilience, improving identification and care for at-risk youth, and enhancing mental health interventions in various settings. The bill authorizes $100 million in appropriations annually from 2025 through 2030.
